New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns had his third 30-10 game
Josh Hart recorded a triple-double with 15 points, 14 rebounds and 12 assists
Key Match Events: The Knicks started to erupt, unleashing an 8-0 run capped by a split from the line by Hart to go up by 16, 95-79
Walker Kessler finally broke Utah’s dry spell with a layup, 95-81
The Knicks lead grew to as much as 20 points, 117-97, late in the game after a 3-pointer by Mikal Bridges to seal the deal
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks played without star guard Jalen Brunson and backup playmaker Deuce McBride
Post-Match Reflections: With the win, the Knicks rose to 24-10 in the season
The Jazz, for their part, dropped to 7-25 and lost their fifth straight game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks will face the red-hot Oklahoma City Thunder, whose 12-game winning streak is the league’s longest
Others: Collin Sexton and Jordan Clarkson led the Jazz with 25 points apiece
OG Anunoby had 22 markers for the Knicks
